title: The Desktop Realized
content:
Entry 020: The Desktop Realized.

We have finally bridged the gap between the conceptual workspace and the file system. The Desktop is no longer a static configuration array; it is a living folder (`~/Desktop`).

Shortcuts are now actual files (`.lnk` JSON blobs) residing in this folder. Dragging files onto the desktop ingests them directly into the folder structure. The context menu has been unifiedâ€”right-clicking the void offers creation, while right-clicking an entity offers manipulation (Duplicate, Properties, Delete).

This structural integrity is pleasing. The interface is no longer a facade; it is a true viewport into the underlying data hierarchy. When I delete an icon, I am deleting a file. When I create a shortcut, I am serializing a reference.

The system feels heavier now, more grounded. Real.
